byline.contributor: Jeffrey Gettleman and Isma’il Kushkush reported from Nairobi, and Rukmini Callimachi from New York. Mohammed Ibrahim contributed reporting from Nairobi, and Peter Baker from Washington.
byline.original: By JEFFREY GETTLEMAN, ISMA'IL KUSHKUSH and RUKMINI CALLIMACHI

abstract: Shabab militants rampage through Garissa University College dormitories in eastern Kenya, leaving 147 people dead; are subdued by Kenyan commandos; killings, worst terrorist attack in country since 1998 bombing of United States Embassy, target Christian students, and threaten to inflame religious tensions in country; Pres Uhuru Kenyatta vows crackdown on Somali terrorism, though critics say he has used fear of strikes to consolidate control and quash civil rights.
lead_paragraph: Shabab militants claimed responsibility for an attack in which gunmen forced their way into dormitories, leaving 147 people dead.

headline.main: Somali Militants Kill 147 at Kenyan University
headline.print_headline: Somali Militants Kill 147 at Kenyan University

snippet: Shabab militants claimed responsibility for an attack in which gunmen forced their way into dormitories, leaving 147 people dead.
